2694.75.text:
Crook: Well, well, there's a lot that's, 
that's done but it's just not in.

2698.82.text:
Somewhat slow going but, 
Schafer: OK.

2701.86.text:
Does anyone want to say 
anything about the schedule?

2706.31.text: Petty: So let's say we do address the feedback

2709.13.text: that we have on Sugar Bunting to get to Beta.

2713.06.text:
And then also enough on space boy,
spaceship to get that to Beta.

2718.40.text: Or maybe we slip a little bit.

2719.84.text:
I guess what's our plan if you know, 
if we do say we get to the end of this sprint

2723.36.text:
and there's clearly some outstanding
 things on spaceship

2726.94.text:
How do we prioritize that versus
 Shellmound, which is up next?

2730.95.text:
Because if we keep going on, we're 
going to be cutting into what

2733.74.text:
we're calling bug/fix/polish time, but 
really that's just bug fixing time.

2736.60.text:
Because the programmers can't 
guarantee a stable game

2738.60.text: if they have like two weeks of bug fix.

2744.22.text: Petty: Coming to a head is one way to say it.

2745.78.text: Wrapping up nicely and elegantly is another.

2748.44.text: And yet a third way is, crash landing a plane.

2752.44.text: I'm not saying either of those is appropriate.

2754.72.text:
Gardner: The way that we've been doing
 stuff, we kind of slip a little bit

2757.08.text:
and I'm worried that we're just going 
to keep slipping until the very end.

2760.66.text: Rice: Yeah. And I think that's why it's good to have

2762.17.text: this kind of picture of the rest of development here,

2765.08.text:
to where we know like the 14th and 
the 28th are the days that we're looking at.

2768.72.text: So that's the time we have to work with.

2770.89.text: And I think just trying to prioritize and weight things

2776.23.text:
to where we're making the most of 
that time is going to be the challenge.

2781.93.text:
Petty: And I guess my interpretation 
of looking at schedule is, that sort of,

2786.46.text:
we need to have a much more 
structured definition of arbitrary polish

2791.68.text:
to that date or we're never going 
to get the game's bugs under control.

2794.85.text:
And you know, I'm sure there 
are categories that are simple.

2797.59.text:
It's not like we're going to leave 
a missing animation

2799.35.text: or someone locked in a "T" pose, right?

2802.06.text:
But you know, if I really liked to 
have that plant waving in the background

2806.85.text:
or it's not quite as polished as, 
or the composition's slightly off

2809.38.text:
in this one frame, well, I think 
the ship has sailed at that point on that stuff.

2812.50.text: Unless there really, unless it's incredibly low risk

2814.84.text: and there's nothing else that's prior priority.

2816.88.text:
Rice: But yeah, there's a lot 
to do in the few months left.

2821.10.text:
Rice: There's just a lot to do and 
everyone's kind of aware of it.

2825.00.text:
So I think people are just really 
trying to push forward right now.

2831.26.text:
'til we're saying pencils down 
and total bug fixing mode.

2834.83.text:
But I would imagine that people will 
start pulling longer hours and you know,

2840.67.text:
trying to get every last bit of polish 
into the game as possible.

2848.72.text:
Crook: We just realized we have 
a lot of work still ahead of us,

2851.10.text:
so I'm just, you know, at night 
I can, I kind of focus on animation.

2855.97.text:
I don't have to answer questions 
or run around, which is fine;

2860.03.text: that's what I'm supposed to do during the day,

2862.14.text:
but it doesn't let me get a lot 
of the tasks that I have on my list.

2866.65.text: So it's just, it's a, you know,

2868.00.text:
it's a process that everything's 
sort of by hand, you know, still.

2874.44.text:
It's a craft that is, you're still sort 
of hand building things, you know.

2881.55.text: It's not really a production line.

2888.69.text: So, but that's what makes the job fun.

2892.50.text:
That's why I like Double Fine, 
'cause we still do that.

2895.38.text: You know, we still sort of do things by hand.

2900.63.text: But you know, it can also make it hard.

2905.41.text: Schafer: I feel bad for Ray.

2906.53.text:
Ray's a family man; he shouldn't 
be staying here late.

2912.33.text: So I say no, no, don't do it.

2914.90.text:
Although I totally rely on him to do that 
so the schedule actually makes sense.

2921.10.text:
Schafer: This footage would be better 
if I made this into a metaphor,

2923.59.text:
like the way that car turned out 
to be a perfect metaphor,

2926.07.text:
but you know, making a game is 
a little bit like decorating a tree.

2931.28.text:
You take small ornaments from a box, 
you hang them on the various branches.

2935.98.text:
The branches are a metaphor 
for the backers, who hold up.

2944.96.text: The ornaments are the sound effects.

2950.34.text: And lights are the voice actors.

2956.70.text: Now do you understand game development?

3009.42.text: I'm just worried that a paper wad will get shot off,

3011.31.text: like that guy who got killed in Voyagers.

3015.10.text: Yeah, there's a paper wad stuck in the...
